utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Will it be much longer?

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: We’ll call you when we’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I’ve been waiting almost an hour.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: We’ll call you when we’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So she’s really coming back?

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: Who’s coming back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don’t know her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You give her a raise? Increase her benefits?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t have TiVo on this thing, can’t rewind. Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: You lower her hours?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don’t even know her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who is this guy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s a patient.

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: He’s examining me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s got to go back to work as soon as I’m done with the examination. Guess I do, too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It’s got to be something. I mean, she didn’t come back because she likes you. Wait a minute! She did come back because she likes you!

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: Heh heh! You dog! You slept with her!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep talking. I’ll finish your exam with a prostate check. I’ve agreed to take her on one date.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?!?

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: So, you in to this girl?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No! She’s not giving me any choice.

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: Wait… she’s making you do her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Date her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Young ingénue doctor falling in love with gruff, older mentor; her sweet gentle nature bringing him to a closer, fuller understanding of his wounded heart.

utterance.speaker: Some guy
utterance.content: Do her, or you’re gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For God’s sake.

utterance.speaker: Wilson and Some guy
utterance.content: Sitting in a tree, K-i-s-s-i-n-g.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Grow up. And learn to harmonize. Damn it!

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who the hell walks around with an open urine sample?

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I didn’t, uh, I didn’t…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think that was a bit of an overreaction?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, he peed on me. I’m not into that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It’s apple juice. Now go find that man and apologize. One more patient complaint and you’re looking at a suspension.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I forgive you for ruining my jacket. Look, you seem like a regular kind of guy, not the type to get another regular guy into trouble, am I right? Twenty bucks cash if you’ll stop crying. Forgive me, yell at me, just give me something I can work with, okay?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Game’s over. You two make nice?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a wheelchair, and get this guy into the ER.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right pupil’s blown.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Holy… you gave the guy a stroke?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So the bear wipes himself with the rabbit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lame.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yo!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I work here.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What, here in this office?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House practically begged me to come back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Please tell me you took him to the cleaners?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Same lousy salary.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then why’d you do it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cause this is the happiest place on Earth. 21-year-old male, comes in with grinding of the teeth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And House gives him a stroke, totally blows out his pupil.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You scared a guy into stroking out?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Does that surprise anyone here?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Blown pupils usually means brain stem edema.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure, but since he’s not dead or in a coma, I’m going with stroke to the optic nerve. CT scan shows two things.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ischemia. Death of brain tissue. Means there’s been some damage, hopefully not permanent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s it. There’s nothing there to tell us what the underlying cause is. We’ve got to do an MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re looking at the wrong part of the scan.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m looking at the brain, what else is there?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The jaw.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The jaw tells us why he stroked?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, the jaw tells us why we can’t do an MRI. Unless we want his jawbone flying across the room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Metal plate. He’s had major reconstruction and there’s no way we’re removing it, so we’re forced to be clever. Angiogram to rule out vascultis, EMG for peripheral neuropathy, tox screen to eliminate drugs, an echo to rule out cardiac emboli. Dr. Cameron. I’d appreciate you keeping the terms of your new contract to yourself. Don’t want everyone clamoring for the same perks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What perks?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nothing you’d be interested in.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So it’s not money, then? Office space, insurance, parking… anything he could offer you, we’d be interested in.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He agreed to go on a date with me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A date? Date, dinner and a movie, naked and sweaty date?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He only committed to the first two.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s so, he’s so old!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And you’re so young.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s a big mistake.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s my boss. I’m allowed to sexually harass my boss. I’ll arrange for the EMG, you want to set up the angiogram, and you get the blood samples, patient history, patient consent?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Like watching an accident about to happen.]

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Morning! Harvey, I’m Dr. Foreman. I’m here to discuss your case.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: I’m Annette, I’m Harvey’s friend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nice to meet you. I need your next of kin, you didn’t fill that out on your intake form.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Harvey’s parents are dead. They died two years ago in a car crash.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I see. So, Harvey, you have any siblings?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: No, and no grandparents or uncles or aunts.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Annette, I don’t want to have to ask you to leave.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I want her to stay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, she can stay. You do the talking. Why’d you come to the clinic this morning?

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Uh, about six months ago, I started grinding my, my… you know, in your mouth, you get, you chew with them…

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Teeth. Harvey’s experiencing a little nominal aphasia, you know, when you can’t remember nouns.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, I think I know what nominal aphasia is. Have you had any treatment for the teeth grinding?

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I went to a, you know, they do that thing with sharp, uh, pointy things.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Needles? Someone took your blood.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: No, they make you breathe.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pulmonologist.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: No, she had this, uh, electrical machine…

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: He saw an acupuncturist.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh huh. Do you know what the acupuncturist did?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: She diagnosed Liver Qi stagnation and sent Harvey to a Shen balancer. He referred him to a homeopathic doctor who sent him to chiropractor.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Naturally.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Well, the chiropractor thought it might be food sensitivity and sent Harvey to a naturopath.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: The naturopath sent me back to the…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Back to the acupuncturist.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay. Well, we’ll need to see the records from all of those, uh, practitioners.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Everything set for the angiogram?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cameron’s got the EMG first. Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Harvey’s guru.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s what she called herself?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s what she acted like.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Hi. I’m having vaginal pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pleasure to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: My OB/GYN died recently. He’s a nice man. Warm hands.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not anymore. So, does it hurt when you tinkle?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s when it’s worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have some vaginal tearing. No sign of brusing, no indication of trauma, forced entry… Ramona. You naughty girl. You’ve either got yourself an 18-year-old boyfriend or an 80-year-old with some little blue pills.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Myron thought he’d just try them out!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lucky you.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prefer it if Myron was a little droopier?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Maybe a little. We used to hold hands, read together, or watch Jeopardy! I haven’t seen Jeopardy! in almost a month!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you talked to him about this?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You try talking a 73-year-old out of sex. With all these male enhancements the pressure to put out’s incredible. It’s worse than high school. He doesn’t get what he wants from me, he’ll get it from Connie in the corner condo. She’s dying her hair red! Major league slut.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here’s a prescription for vaginal estrogen suppositories. It’ll help with the lubrication.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Thank you. Maybe you could give Myron a prescription. Something weaker than he’s got now? Tell him it’s better for his heart – he’d buy that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can’t tell him the truth, so you want me to lie to him?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Would you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Close your legs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nerves stimulate muscles to move by creating a small electrical current. The machine will measure that. And I will insert this needle into various muscles and ask you to flex. Sometimes it can be painful. Let me know, and I can pull back –

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: No. I mean, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay. Put your arm out to the side. You all right?

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I’m good. You don’t have to stop.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Raise your arm up over your head.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The EMG was clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, based on this history it’s either toxic herbs from the homeopath, spinal damage from the chiropractor, infection from the needle that the acupuncturist accidentally let sit in eye of newt, or the Shen balancer. What the hell is a “shen” and how come it’s lopsided?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The only abnormal test result we found was on the echo report. Mitral valve prolapse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hang up a shingle and condemn the narrowness and greed of Western medicine, you’d make a damn fine living.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Clot’s formed on a faulty valve, gets sent to the brain, voila! Stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course, no harm, no foul. It’s just taking a few bucks from superstitious idiots, right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could also be an aneurysm due to trauma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Trauma? From what, the chiropractic treatments? It’s bacterial endocarditis, an infected valve. We should do blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Except the six months that he had with these charlatans might have been spent going to someone who looks at things that exist in the real world. But that’s just me being all narrow again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I noticed a small bruit when I listened to Harvey’s left carotid. You could hear that if you had an aneurysm from trauma.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Aneurysm would have shown on the angiogram.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, not necessarily.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. Quite a dilemma. Oh, great pool hall oracle, grant me guidance. Do we go with Foreman’s theory, which is at least marginally supported by medical test results, or Chase’s theory, which is completely unsupported by medical evidence. What to do…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The guy obviously broke his jaw somehow. Who knows what other trauma he’s suffered? We should do the angiogram again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And all signs point to… Sorry, Chase. The gods have spoken. Start Harvey on blood thinners and antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wow. Yeah, I get it. House is adorable. I just want to hold him and never let go.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Oh, my God! What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’re choking him!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foreman, stop. Let her go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She was trying to kill him!

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: No. No, she wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His vitals seem okay.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Please. Please don’t hurt her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What the hell is going on in here?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She’s… she’s a dominatrix. Right, Annette?

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: The patient asked you to strangle him?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Harvey is an asphyxiaphyliac. He likes to be strangled or smothered.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: That’s just sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that’s an intriguing legal opinion. Geez, what kind of a lawyer is he?

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: You want a legal opinion? Call the cops.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: I was careful. I watched the monitors, made sure his O2 stats were over 90. I would never hurt him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then what was the point?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Harvey was upset. He needed to calm down. To feel in control by being controlled.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Eh.. um… He pays you for this?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: In return, he does my taxes and cleans my house.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We’re not done here, we have to talk!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Call the cops, bar her from the hospital, force her to pierce your nipples… not really medical decisions.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was a long time ago. I was seeing this woman. A banker, and turns out she liked to be burned.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You actually dated someone who likes to get burned?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, why would you want to be in a relationship with someone that’s so obviously only going to lead to pain?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was a weird scene. I observed –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase. Did you know about this woman? What she does?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I met her at some parties, yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wouldn’t have tortured you if I knew you liked it. Well, here’s a phrase to remember: “Hey, this guy might have been pounded on the head one too many times!”

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I said I thought it was a trauma induced aneurysm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, could have carried a tad more weight if you’d mentioned the “liking pain” thing. You’re on my naughty list. Sorry, no leather stethoscope this Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m not into –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume you never started him on antibiotics or blood thinners before Mistress Ilsa’s rude interruption.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was probably a good thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start him on antibiotics and blood thinners.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You still think Chase is wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, he’s probably right.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then we should schedule him for vascular surgery. Go into the carotids, find the aneurysm, repair it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If we put him on blood thinners, he might bleed out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But if Foreman’s right about it being bacterial endocarditis, and we –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I think Chase is right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, if Foreman used to be right about it being blood clots, and we take the surgery route, then we’ll probably kill the guy. So, start him on blood thinners, and if he has another stroke, then we’ll schedule the surgery. Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: You Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have a feeling I’m going to regret this, but yes.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Ramona said I should come to you for my refill. Uh, with, for the beginning to droop? She said you’d probably want to talk to me first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She lied. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Always happy to make people happy. Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: I – I don’t know how much more of this I can take.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How much more of what?

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Sex.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don’t want more sex?

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: My golf swing is all messed up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, here’s a radical thought. Talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: The truth?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds crazy when you put it like that.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Oh, Ramona’s got a big appetite. If I don’t perform, I don’t want to lose her. You got a pharmacy around here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the hospital? Could be. Let’s see if we can find it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got any blue pills?

utterance.speaker: Pharmacist
utterance.content: You looking for ED medication?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that’s one example of a blue pill. Name six others.

utterance.speaker: Pharmacist
utterance.content: There’s a brand of acetaminophen out…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfect. Fill her up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Little busy here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I heard about Dr. Cameron’s conditions for coming back to work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s purely business. I’ll make sure you get the recipt.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I think it’s a good thing. What happened in your last relationship, it’s no reason to wall yourself from people forever. 5 years of self-pity is probably enough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Well, you’ve certainly given me a lot to think about. If only I was as open as you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, it was your blouse I was talking about.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Bear in mind Cameron’s probably the only female that can tolerate you. Wear the sky-blue shirt. It almost makes you look nice.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: They said she couldn’t come back into the hospital. They won’t let me see her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Harvey, you’re lucky she wasn’t arrested. What were you thinking, doing that at a hospital? Squeeze my fingers?

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I was scared.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need you to squeeze with both hands.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Weakness in his right arm and hand. Harvey’s having mini-strokes; the blood thinners aren’t making a difference.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stop the treatment. Sorry, we tried your way, you could not have been wronger.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I said Chase was probably right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh yeah, we’ve all got perfect 20-20 hindsight. Get a hold of Main in vascular, see if his surgical dance card is free for tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: About tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You couldn’t keep your mouth shut.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I didn’t see any reason to. Where are we going? I want to make sure I dress appropriately.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be army boots and t-shirt. It’s the county paintball tourney. First prize is fifty bucks; I’ll split it with you if you hold your end up.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not sure if that was the deal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Relax. I made a reservation at Café Spiletto. Regarding wardrobe: are you too young to remember spandex?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’ll figure something out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The surgery will repair the damaged blood vessels in your neck and your strokes will stop.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: All this is because of the strangulation?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: More like strangulations.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: My parents were right. I’m a loser. I don’t know what to do.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Harvey, calm down.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I need to talk to Annette.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can do this on your own. Surgery’s the only –

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: She hates me. I’ve been calling, I’ve been calling and she’s not picking up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Harvey, you don’t need –

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I can’t, I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Harvey, you will do what I say.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I don’t want surgery!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sign the consent. Sign it!

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: I can’t do anything. No surgery! No surgery! No surgery!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We could give him anti-depressants, see if he changes his mind.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I already did. Mashed them up in his applesauce, it’ll lighten him up soon enough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone should just tell him to do it. Way faster.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Except that’s forgery. Also illegal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And I already tried.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not you. Where’s a good dominatrix when you need one?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Annette’s barred from the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you get caught, Cuddy’s got a hairbrush. And believe me, she knows how to use it.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: They let you come back.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: Not because you deserve it. You’ve been bad. You will have the surgery, do you understand? Do not laugh at me. You will respect –

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Where do you get off telling me what to do? Get out of my way, you back-faced witch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Is that part of their deal, or…

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: This isn’t like him. Something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Get out! Get out! Get out, get out! [Harvey knocks over the tray with dishes on it before Chase and Foreman get his arms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Emotional swings, he’s having another stroke. Harvey!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s crashing. Can we get a cart in here?

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: So, what’s that, two strokes you’ve scared this guy into?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s making me question my view of myself as a people person.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: Now you want to do surgery on him without his consent.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The kid’s in a coma, he needs the surgery!

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: He said no. We can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Emergent situation, invoke heroic measures.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: You need a court order.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great, where do I get me one of them? Do I need to lawyer up?

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: I’ll need to show the judge an affidavit from next of kin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, they might have a problem signing anything seeing as how they’re dead.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: He’ll want proof.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like what, dad’s hand? I don’t even know where they’re buried.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: Bring me a published obit or a death certificate and we’ll run with it. I don’t want you to mess up your clothes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His parents were accountants, maybe there’s an obit in the trade papers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They guy lives in Market Town. I don’t know if he grew there, but we could check the local funeral home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great, and when your searches turn up nothing you should try to find out where they live.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He said they were dead.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Accountants, they’re usually pretty good with money, so how come he lives in a slum like Market Town?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe they were bad accountants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two bad accountants from the Pacific Rim? The odds are astronomical.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe Harvey burned through their money.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or maybe they cut him off when they found out about his proclivities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’d be my bet. Go to his apartments. See if you can find his folks. Address, number, something.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, can I talk to you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Look, Cameron’s a friend. This whole dating thing –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Time’s up. Thanks for playing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve been on the scene more than you recently.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way ahead of you. I’ve got a case of malt liquor stashed in the trunk, Mr. Marvin Gaye on the CD, we are gonna get all the way down. Now move.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Come on, you’re not into her. Most guys who aren’t interested in a woman try to sugarcoat it, be nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you know me too well.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s what I’m saying. I think you should go with your instincts here. Be a jerk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m missing my soap for this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Women love to be right. You’ve got to leave them feeling superior. Like they’ve dodged a bullet. If you’re nice, she’ll blame herself –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And fall for me even more. The Love Doctor has made an art of breaking up with women. ‘Cause you’re convinced that the loss of you would be too devastating for any woman to handle.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m the one with the serious ego problem here. I’m just saying: some relationships aren’t meant to happen.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Harvey’s school registration.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Permanent home address? Emergency contacts?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Annette Raines.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mistress Annette. You have to extort a date out of House. You think that’s a bad sign? Cameron?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: High school yearbook. Think this might give us a clue, Sherlock?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House isn’t going to hand you anything. You want him, you’ve gotta take him. Jump him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Harvey. H-a-r-v-e-y.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m sorry to have bothered you. Thank you. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, Harvey Park. Great, we’ve been looking for you! I’m calling from the Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital. Harvey’s here, and it’s rather… He hung up.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You tell him why you were calling?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I didn’t get a chance.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Call back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ll do it. Let the master show you how it’s done. Mr. Park? This is Dr. House calling from Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital in New Jersey. Your son Harvey is dead. We need you to identify the body. Yes, I’m sorry, it’s the law. There’s a real art to delivering bad news.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: They’re gonna show up at the morgue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Be sure to let me know when Cuddy starts screaming.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You lied to them!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s only a white lie. Technically, all I did was call them a little early. Trust me, he’ll be dead real soon. Actually, I saved you some rush hour traffic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Just as soon as you sign this surgery consent. I have a pen.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Harvey’s your son. I’m sure you still care about him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you don’t get off on embarrassment the way your son does. I guess it skips a generation.

utterance.speaker: Lawyer
utterance.content: How much money would it take to compensate you –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you guys can haggle in a minute. But here’s the thing. Humiliation comes in all kinds of packages. People finding out that your son’s a perv, that’s pretty high up there. People finding out that you’d rather let your son die than sign a piece of paper, where’s that rank? And trust me, if I have to paste up a sign in every nail salon and dumpling shop in Pennsylvania, I’ll make sure they know. Your son will be in surgery first thing in the morning. Dumplings, that was a cheap shot.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hi. Are you, uh, can we talk?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Gee, I wonder what this is going to be about.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just want to make sure no one gets hurt.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I will be fine. Everybody’s acting like I’m going out with Jack the Ripper.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, it’s not you I’m worried about. It’s been a long time since he opened up to someone, and I… you better be absolutely sure you want this because if he opens up again and gets hurt, I don’t think there’s going to be a next time.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re worried I’m going to break his heart?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The wide side’s too short. You’re gonna look like Lou Costello.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is a mistake. I don’t know how to have casual conversation. You think you’re talking about one thing, and either you are and it’s incredibly boring, or you’re not because it’s subtext and you need a decoder ring.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Open doors for her, help her with her chair –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have been on a date.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uh, not since disco died. Comment on her shoes, her earrings, and then move on to D.H.A. Her dreams, hopes and aspirations. Trust me. Panty-peeler. Oh, and if you need condoms, I’ve got some.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did your wife give them to you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Drug rep. They’ve got antibiotics built in, somehow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I should cancel. I’ve got a patient in surgery tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And if you were a surgeon, that would actually matter. That’s a good idea, settle your nerves. Get me a beer, too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No beer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re gonna eat before dinner?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is pretty lame, right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think she likes lame.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s beautiful. And you look very handsome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’ve always loved this restaurant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s changed a lot since the last time I was here. It used to be a strip joint. Nice earrings.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: My mom’s. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice shoes. Comfortable?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not expecting you to be someone you’re not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We’re in a restaurant, we’re dressed up, we’re eating. If not small talk, what is there?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: According to Freud, and I’m paraphrasing, instinct of love toward an object demands a mastery to obtain it, and if a person feels they can’t control the object or feel threatened by it, they act negatively toward it. Like an eighth-grade boy punching a girl.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I treat you like garbage, so I must really like you. Given your Freudian theory, what does it mean if I start being nice to you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That you’re getting in touch with your feelings.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. So there’s absolutely nothing I can do to make you think that I don’t like you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Sorry, no. I have one evening with you, one chance, and I don’t want to waste it talking about what wines you like or what movies you hate. I want to know how you feel about me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You live under the delusion that you can fix everything that isn’t perfect. That’s why you married a man who was dying of cancer. You don’t love, you need. And now that your husband is dead, you’re looking for your new charity case. That’s why you’re going out with me. I’m twice your age, I’m not great looking, I’m not charming, I’m not even nice. What I am is what you need. I’m damaged.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Came in late. Had a good time last night?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How’s the surgery going?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Harvey’s doing fine so far. How’d the night go?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was fine, how was your evening?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She had the ravioli, I had the puttanesca.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, I really want to know about the quality of the food. Either something very good happened, or something very bad. Which is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I did have a little indigestion afterwards. Maybe it was the garlic bread.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Or the wine. Something made my eyes puffy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Crying in your pillow can do that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was the wine. We had a nice, candid conversation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing deep, mostly small talk.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Took your advice, complimented her shoes, that’s fifteen minutes of chat right there.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No snide comments?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I guess, when we talked about you guys.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Just answer one question:

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You two going to do dinner again?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Hey kids, you were wrong. No aneurysm, no nothing. This guy’s clean.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which means we’ve got no idea what’s causing the strokes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s had two more post-op. We won’t know the extent of the damage until he comes out of the coma. If he comes out.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe we should go back to the blood thinners, up the dosage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it’s not clots, a loading dose of blood thinners is gonna make him bleed out of his ears. Then he won’t be able to hear. Oy ve. Nobody home, leave a message!

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: This is important!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase, Cameron, get another angiogram and echo. Better get a full-body scan. If it is clots, it’d be good to know where they are. Sorry about that. Guy dying.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Those pills you gave Myron, they’re not working.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, glad to see you’ve got the correct perspective on the thing.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Well, the old ones, you know, made me feel like a tree!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice visual.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: The new ones, well, might as well be eating candy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Candy wouldn’t take away your headaches.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You came to me and told me that you were having too much sex.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I never did!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You too, Sequoia.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Well no, that’s not true, I…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know that everybody lies, but you’d think that after a certain amount of time together you wouldn’t be trying so hard. Your rings don’t match.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: What, well, why would they?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, style is one thing, but one silver, one gold? How long have you guys been married?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: 49 years.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: 55 years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn it, you’re having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Did you really say you wanted to have less sex.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Well, less. If I wanted none I’d stay home with Esther.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I just need a little rest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You guys aren’t the victim of the little blue pill, you’re the problem!

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Me, too. I should just have told you how I felt.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aw. Oh, welcome to hell.

utterance.speaker: Myron
utterance.content: Hey, how ‘bout the pills?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like you guys are good to go drug-free for a while.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Chase, these breath mints you’ve been popping since yesterday. Are they a new fetish?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, I got them at Harvey’s. What, I just took two boxes; the guy’s got a whole drawer of them!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you didn’t find that interesting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, there’s lots of interesting stuff at his place. The mints weren’t high up on the list.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase, get your nose in here.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you’re trying to humiliate me, I told you –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, just put your face in his mouth.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rich, wouldn’t you say?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Uh. Smells like old vomit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Number one sign of fulminating osteomylitis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Infection of the jaw?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably from the original break. Never healed properly. Infected tissue from the jaw breaks off, blocks blood flow to the brain, and life just isn’t worth living without blood.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It was hidden from the scans by the metal plate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And an infection of the jaw isn’t likely to show up on blood tests.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So how do we confirm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like this. Ladies and gentlemen, we have pus. We’re gonna remove the jaw. Anybody got a buzzsaw? Okay, call a surgeon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Dr. House. How’s tricks, Annette?

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: I just wanted to see if he was okay. I’ll leave.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. I came to talk to you both. Like I tell all my patients, you’ve simply got to say “no” to strangulation. Me, I’m a freak, I get off on not being in pain. That, and chocolate-covered marshmallow bunnies.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: He’s not a freak.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, he is. A little. But it’s got to stop. Or he’ll die.

utterance.speaker: Annette
utterance.content: It’s not about pain. It’s about being open, being completely vulnerable to another person. If you can learn to be that deeply trusting… it changes you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, lock him in a cage. That should be fine, medically.

utterance.speaker: Harvey
utterance.content: Dr. House. Were my parents here? Did they come to see me?
